S. 100: "Probably the most important conclusion to bedrawn about the experimental application of our linearprogramming model is that it is highly desirable firstto check on the extent to which the ordinal axiom oftransitivity is satisfied. The lack of transitivity is clearlya major factor limiting the predictive power of the modelin the present experiment. Theoretically the model isprepared to take care of any intransitivities; but ifthe subject radically changes his mind on the simpleordering of outcomes then obvioulsy no model willbe able to predict his choices with any great success.
